## Wet Lab Tools/Databases

### General

- [ATCC](https://www.atcc.org/): Product provider. 

### Biochemistry Assays

- [Addgene](https://www.addgene.org/): A database for plasmids and vectors.
- [NEB Restriction Endonucleases/Buffer Chart](https://www.neb.com/en-us/tools-and-resources/usage-guidelines/nebuffer-performance-chart-with-restriction-enzymes?srsltid=AfmBOooR-u8IhWamN5uAkwVE7JbKc5OB96js4kk2o8qA6oUJR1mx_Ed_): A reference table for NEB endonucleases. 
- [TALEN Designer](https://tale-nt.cac.cornell.edu/): A TALEN vector designer.
- [NCBI Primer Blast](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/tools/primer-blast/): Primer designing tool.
- [AAT Bioquest](https://www.aatbio.com/data-sets/restriction-enzymes-cut-sites-reference-table): Restriction Enzymes Cut Sizes Reference Table.
- [Vitascientific.com](https://www.vitascientific.com/information/calculator): Melting Temperature (Tm) Calculation.
- [SignalP](https://services.healthtech.dtu.dk/service.php?SignalP-4.1): Predicts the presence and location of signal peptide cleavage sites in amino acid sequences from different organisms.
- [Genetic Pertubation Platform (GPP)/RNAi Platform](https://portals.broadinstitute.org/gpp/public/): A collection of webtools for RNAi - functional investigations of the mammalian genome that can reveal how genetic alterations lead to changes in phenotype, by Broad Institute. 
- [CHOPCHOP](https://chopchop.cbu.uib.no/): A web tool for selecting target sites for CRISPR/Cas9 etc.-directed mutagenesis.
- [OmniGuide RNA Design Tool](https://www.genscript.com/gRNA-design-tool.html): A web tool to design high-performance CRISPR guide RNAs by GenScript. 

### Microscopy/Imaging

- [CellProfiler](https://cellprofiler.org/): Open-source image processing software. 

### Cell Culture

- [Useful Numbers for Cell Culture](https://www.thermofisher.com/us/en/home/references/gibco-cell-culture-basics/cell-culture-protocols/cell-culture-useful-numbers.html): The ThermoFisher cell culture guide.

### Model Organisms

- [The Jackson Laboratory](https://www.notion.so/jax.org): A database for mouse models.
- [TAIR](https://www.arabidopsis.org/): An *Arabidopsis* information database.

---

## Bioinformatics Tools/Databases

### General

- [BioConductor](https://www.bioconductor.org/about/release-announcements/#release-announcements): A powerful R package for bioinformatics analysis.

### Databases

- [NIH National Center for Biotechnology Information (NCBI)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/): The ultimate biology database.
    - [NCBI dbSNP](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/snp/): A database of human single nucleotide variations, microsatellites, and small-scale indels. 
- [EMBL's European Bioinformatics Instituten (EMBL-EBI)](https://www.ebi.ac.uk/): Unleashing the potential of big data in biology.

#### Human

- [GeneCards](https://www.genecards.org/): An integrative database on all annotated and predicted human genes by the Weizmann Institute of Science. 
- [The Human Protein Atlas](https://www.proteinatlas.org/): An open access resource for human proteins. 

##### Pharmacogenomics

- [PharmGKB/ClinPGx](https://www.pharmgkb.org/): A comprehensive clinical pharmacogenomics (PGx) resource database.
- [Pharmacogene Variation Consortium (PharmVar)](https://www.pharmvar.org/genes): A database for drug-related genes.
- [Clinical Pharmacogenetics Implementation Consortium (CPIC)](https://cpicpgx.org/): A database for drug-related genes.

#### Microbiology

- [CARD/The Comprehensive Antibiotic Resistance Database](https://card.mcmaster.ca/ontology/36319): A database for ARGs/ARBs.
- [ViralZone](https://viralzone.expasy.org/): A database for information on viruses (descriptions, images, and classifications) maintained by the Swiss-Prot group and SIB.
- [The Global Initiative on Sharing All Influenza Data (GISAID)](https://gisaid.org/): A database for recent variants of hCoV-19, Dengue, Influenza, Mpox and RSV. 

### Sequence Alignment/Search

- [NCBI BLAST/Basic Local Alignment Search Tool](https://blast.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/Blast.cgi): comparing primary biological information like nucleotide and amino acid sequences.

### Protein Structural Biology

- [CSB PDB/Protein Data Bank](https://www.rcsb.org/): A database for protein structures.
- [AlphaFold](https://alphafold.ebi.ac.uk/): A database/tool for protein structures predicted by AlphaFold.
    - [AlphaFold Server](https://alphafoldserver.com/welcome): A web-service that generate biomolecular structure predictions. 
- [UniProt](https://www.uniprot.org/): A database for protein sequence and functional information. 
- [UCSF Chimera](https://zhuanlan.zhihu.com/p/427354394): A tool for protein 3D structure analysis.
- [SWISS-MODEL](https://swissmodel.expasy.org/): A fully automated protein structure homology-modelling server. 
- [FoldSeek](https://search.foldseek.com/): A web tool for fast and sensitive comparisons of large protein structure sets. 

### Phylogenetics

- [phyloseq](https://joey711.github.io/phyloseq/): R package for microbiome analysis. 
- [TimeTree: The Timescale of Life](http://www.timetree.org/): A tool for phylogenetic analysis (*for fun*).

### Functional Analysis/Gene Annotation

- [Gene Ontology (GO)](https://geneontology.org/): A bioinformatics initiative to unify the representation of gene and gene product attributes across all species. Basically, a gene functional annotation database. 
    - [GO terms/description full list (all organisms)](https://current.geneontology.org/ontology/go.obo)
    - [AmiGO2](https://amigo.geneontology.org/amigo/landing): The official tool to search and browse the GO database. 
    - [QuickGO](https://www.ebi.ac.uk/QuickGO/): The EMBL database for GO terms. 
    - [ontologyIndex](https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/ontologyIndex/ontologyIndex.pdf): An R package to navigate through `.obo` files. 
- [eggNOG](http://eggnog5.embl.de/#/app/home): The EMBL database of orthology relationships, functional annotation, and gene evolutionary histories. 
    - [eggNOG-mapper](http://eggnog-mapper.embl.de/): Using the eggNOG database to map gene functions. 
- [PolyPhen-2](http://genetics.bwh.harvard.edu/pph2/): A tool for predicting possible impact of AAS on the structure and function of a human protein.

### Next-Generation Sequencing (NGS) Analysis

- [INSaFLU-TELEVIR](https://insaflu.insa.pt/): A web-based tool to deal with NGS data for metagenomics virus detection and routine genomic surveillance. 
- [NextStrain](https://nextstrain.org/): An open-source project to harness the scientific and public health potential of pathogen genome data. 
- [DADA2](https://benjjneb.github.io/dada2/): An analysis tool for Illumina Miseq data.

## Misc.

### Data Visualization

- [GraphPad Prism](https://www.graphpad.com/features): A graphing and statistics software for scientists.
- [ggplot2](https://ggplot2.tidyverse.org/): *We have GraphPad Prism at home!*
- [BioRender](https://app.biorender.com/gallery/illustrations): A tool to make scientific graphs.
- [SwissBioPics](https://www.swissbiopics.org/): An interactive library of cell images for the visualization of subcellular location data. 
- [RNArtist](https://github.com/fjossinet/RNArtist): A tool for RNA 2D structure visualization. 
- [ViralVar](https://appset.shinyapps.io/viralvar2/): A platform for the visualization of viral lineages and mutations. 

### Wet Lab Simulation

- [SnapGene](https://www.snapgene.com/about): A desktop software to simulate DNA cloning and genetic engineering experiments. 
- [Benchling](https://www.benchling.com/): A cloud-based platform similar to SnapGene.

### Forums

- [Biostars Forum](https://www.biostars.org/): A bioinformatics forum.
- [r/bioinformatics](https://www.reddit.com/r/bioinformatics/): The reddit bioinformatics forum.
- [r/labrats](https://www.reddit.com/r/labrats/): The reddit wet lab forum.
